newsitem.title: USA: Premenos stock plunges; posts loss, CEO resigns.
newsitem.headline: Premenos stock plunges; posts loss, CEO resigns.

text.p: The stock of Premenos Technology Corp. lost more than 50 percent of its value Tuesday after the electronic communications software maker reported a loss for the latest quarter and the resignation of a top executive.
Premenos tumbled $8.875 to $7.75, after notching a 52-week low of $6.75 in active trading on the Nasdaq market.
The Concord, Calif.-based firm late Monday reported a third-quarter loss of $2.2 million, or 20 cents a share, vs. a profit of $143,000, or 2 cents a share, a year ago.
Its posted revenues of $8.0 million, up from $6.5 million.
Premenos, which said the loss included a $2.5 million acquisition-related charge, also announced that its president and chief executive officer, Daniel Federman, resigned.
The company went public with a 4.3 million share initial public offering in September of 1995, with the stock debuting at $18. It peaked at $47 last November.
